attributes.action: The salary for a public servant should not be more than the Prime Minister
attributes.additional_details:
It is an outrage that the Chief Executives in some of the poorest Local Authorities are being paid tens of thousands of pounds more than the Prime Minister.  

For example, 

Redbridge £180+
Newham £195k+
Tower Hamlets £182k+
Lambeth £180k+
Lewisham £192k+
Southwark £193k+

We could save £270k on just these six boroughs!  The equivalent of nine or ten teachers!

Follow the discussion here:
New Redbridge Chief Executive Officer: https://www.streetlife.com/conversation/tok1u011qggu/?t=rVk3R
attributes.background: General public opinion is that a single person in a public serving role should not be paid more than the prime minister and the savings made in a pay cut should go towards teachers, nurses, junior doctors and front line staff who are educating the future and looking after us in times of need.

rejection.details: We cannot accept your petition as the salaries of chief executives of local councils are a matter for the local councils rather than for the UK Government.
